newsitem.title: USA: Lean US gov't may damp Aug payroll data - Wrightson.
newsitem.headline: Lean US gov't may damp Aug payroll data - Wrightson.

text.p: U.S. payroll creation in August -- a usually strong month for American labor markets -- is likely to have been damped by a leaner government sector, according to the research firm Wrightson Associates.

Wrightson's forecast for a 200,000 payroll increase in August could be good news for a wary Treasury market, but the firm's call for a four-cent increase in August average hourly earnings may spell trouble.
Wrightson economist Mike Cloherty note "from 1991 through 1995, the average August (payroll) increase was 76,000 larger than the average for the first seven months of the year."
